è¿™é‡Œï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬ä½¿ç”¨ã€ŠCoding Neural Network - Forward Propagation and Backpropagationã€‹ä¸­æ‰€å†™çš„å‡½æ•°æ¥å®ç°å‚æ•°åˆå§‹åŒ–ã€å‰å‘ä¼ æ’­ã€åå‘ä¼ æ’­ä»¥åŠäº¤å‰ç†µæŸå¤±çš„è®¡ç®—ã€‚

# Loading packages
import sys

import h5py
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from numpy.linalg import norm
import seaborn as sns

sys.path.append("../scripts/")
from coding_neural_network_from_scratch import (initialize_parameters,
 Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â L_model_forward,
 Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â L_model_backward,
 Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â compute_cost)
# Import the data
train_dataset = h5py.File("../data/train_catvnoncat.h5")
X_train = np.array(train_dataset["train_set_x"]).T
y_train = np.array(train_dataset["train_set_y"]).T
X_train = X_train.reshape(-1, 209)
y_train = y_train.reshape(-1, 209)

X_train.shape, y_train.shape
((12288, 209), (1, 209))


ç¼–å†™ helper å‡½æ•°ï¼Œå¸®åŠ©å®ç°å‚æ•°å’Œæ¢¯åº¦è¯å…¸ï¼ˆgradients dictionaryï¼‰åˆ°å‘é‡çš„ç›¸äº’è½¬æ¢ã€‚


def dictionary_to_vector(params_dict):"""
 Â  Â Roll a dictionary into a single vector.

 Â  Â Arguments
 Â  Â ---------
 Â  Â params_dict : dict
 Â  Â  Â  Â learned parameters.

 Â  Â Returns
 Â  Â -------
 Â  Â params_vector : array
 Â  Â  Â  Â vector of all parameters concatenated.
 Â  Â """count = 0for key in params_dict.keys():new_vector = np.reshape(params_dict[key], (-1, 1))if count == 0:theta_vector = new_vectorelse:theta_vector = np.concatenate((theta_vector, new_vector))count += 1return theta_vectordef vector_to_dictionary(vector, layers_dims):"""
 Â  Â Unroll parameters vector to dictionary using layers dimensions.

 Â  Â Arguments
 Â  Â ---------
 Â  Â vector : array
 Â  Â  Â  Â parameters vector.
 Â  Â layers_dims : list or array_like
 Â  Â  Â  Â dimensions of each layer in the network.

 Â  Â Returns
 Â  Â -------
 Â  Â parameters : dict
 Â  Â  Â  Â dictionary storing all parameters.
 Â  Â """L = len(layers_dims)parameters = {}k = 0for l in range(1, L):# Create temp variable to store dimension used on each layerw_dim = layers_dims[l] * layers_dims[l - 1]b_dim = layers_dims[l]# Create temp var to be used in slicing parameters vectortemp_dim = k + w_dim# add parameters to the dictionaryparameters["W" + str(l)] = vector[k:temp_dim].reshape(layers_dims[l], layers_dims[l - 1])parameters["b" + str(l)] = vector[temp_dim:temp_dim + b_dim].reshape(b_dim, 1)k += w_dim + b_dimreturn parametersdef gradients_to_vector(gradients):"""
 Â  Â Roll all gradients into a single vector containing only dW and db.

 Â  Â Arguments
 Â  Â ---------
 Â  Â gradients : dict
 Â  Â  Â  Â storing gradients of weights and biases for all layers: dA, dW, db.

 Â  Â Returns
 Â  Â -------
 Â  Â new_grads : array
 Â  Â  Â  Â vector of only dW and db gradients.
 Â  Â """# Get the number of indices for the gradients to iterate overvalid_grads = [key for key in gradients.keys()if not key.startswith("dA")]L = len(valid_grads)// 2count = 0# Iterate over all gradients and append them to new_grads listfor l in range(1, L + 1):if count == 0:new_grads = gradients["dW" + str(l)].reshape(-1, 1)new_grads = np.concatenate((new_grads, gradients["db" + str(l)].reshape(-1, 1)))else:new_grads = np.concatenate((new_grads, gradients["dW" + str(l)].reshape(-1, 1)))new_grads = np.concatenate((new_grads, gradients["db" + str(l)].reshape(-1, 1)))count += 1return new_grads

æœ€åï¼Œç¼–å†™æ¢¯åº¦æ£€éªŒå‡½æ•°ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨æ­¤å‡½æ•°è®¡ç®—è§£ææ¢¯åº¦å’Œæ•°å€¼æ¢¯åº¦ä¹‹é—´çš„å·®å€¼ï¼Œå¹¶å€Ÿæ­¤åˆ¤æ–­åå‘ä¼ æ’­çš„å®ç°ä»£ç æ˜¯å¦æ­£ç¡®ã€‚æˆ‘ä»¬éšæœºæŠ½å– 1 ä¸ªæ ·æœ¬æ¥è®¡ç®—å·®å€¼ï¼š


def forward_prop_cost(X, parameters, Y, hidden_layers_activation_fn="tanh"):"""
 Â  Â Implements the forward propagation and computes the cost.

 Â  Â Arguments
 Â  Â ---------
 Â  Â X : 2d-array
 Â  Â  Â  Â input data, shape: number of features x number of examples.
 Â  Â parameters : dict
 Â  Â  Â  Â parameters to use in forward prop.
 Â  Â Y : array
 Â  Â  Â  Â true "label", shape: 1 x number of examples.
 Â  Â hidden_layers_activation_fn : str
 Â  Â  Â  Â activation function to be used on hidden layers: "tanh", "relu".

 Â  Â Returns
 Â  Â -------
 Â  Â cost : float
 Â  Â  Â  Â cross-entropy cost.
 Â  Â """# Compute forward propAL, _ = L_model_forward(X, parameters, hidden_layers_activation_fn)# Compute costcost = compute_cost(AL, Y)return costdef gradient_check(parameters, gradients, X, Y, layers_dims, epsilon=1e-7,hidden_layers_activation_fn="tanh"):"""
 Â  Â Checks if back_prop computes correctly the gradient of the cost output by
 Â  Â forward_prop.

 Â  Â Arguments
 Â  Â ---------
 Â  Â parameters : dict
 Â  Â  Â  Â storing all parameters to use in forward prop.
 Â  Â gradients : dict
 Â  Â  Â  Â gradients of weights and biases for all layers: dA, dW, db.
 Â  Â X : 2d-array
 Â  Â  Â  Â input data, shape: number of features x number of examples.
 Â  Â Y : array
 Â  Â  Â  Â true "label", shape: 1 x number of examples.
 Â  Â epsilon : 
 Â  Â  Â  Â tiny shift to the input to compute approximate gradient.
 Â  Â layers_dims : list or array_like
 Â  Â  Â  Â dimensions of each layer in the network.

 Â  Â Returns
 Â  Â -------
 Â  Â difference : float
 Â  Â  Â  Â difference between approx gradient and back_prop gradient
 Â  Â """# Roll out parameters and gradients dictionariesparameters_vector = dictionary_to_vector(parameters)gradients_vector = gradients_to_vector(gradients)# Create vector of zeros to be used with epsilongrads_approx = np.zeros_like(parameters_vector)for i in range(len(parameters_vector)):# Compute cost of theta + epsilontheta_plus = np.copy(parameters_vector)theta_plus[i] = theta_plus[i] + epsilonj_plus = forward_prop_cost(X, vector_to_dictionary(theta_plus, layers_dims), Y,hidden_layers_activation_fn)# Compute cost of theta - epsilontheta_minus = np.copy(parameters_vector)theta_minus[i] = theta_minus[i] - epsilonj_minus = forward_prop_cost(X, vector_to_dictionary(theta_minus, layers_dims), Y,hidden_layers_activation_fn)# Compute numerical gradientsgrads_approx[i] = (j_plus - j_minus) / (2 * epsilon)# Compute the difference of numerical and analytical gradientsnumerator = norm(gradients_vector - grads_approx)denominator = norm(grads_approx) + norm(gradients_vector)difference = numerator / denominatorif difference > 10e-7:print ("\033[31mThere is a mistake in back-propagation " +\
 Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  "implementation. The difference is: {}".format(difference))else:print ("\033[32mThere implementation of back-propagation is fine! "+\
 Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  "The difference is: {}".format(difference))return difference

# Set up neural network architecture
layers_dims = [X_train.shape[0], 5, 5, 1]

# Initialize parameters
parameters = initialize_parameters(layers_dims)

# Randomly selecting 1 example from training data
perms = np.random.permutation(X_train.shape[1])
index = perms[:1]

# Compute forward propagation
AL, caches = L_model_forward(X_train[:, index], parameters, "tanh")

# Compute analytical gradients
gradients = L_model_backward(AL, y_train[:, index], caches, "tanh")

# Compute difference of numerical and analytical gradients
difference = gradient_check(parameters, gradients, X_train[:, index], y_train[:, index], layers_dims)
